name: Book
description: An enormous book rests among scrolls and parchment, with a quill and ink nearby. The Book card embodies written information.

person: A writer, poet, or compulsive note-taker.
A well-educated person who reads often.
creatureTrap: A creature that keeps an exhaustive diary in some form, or that seeks a scribe to record its deeds.
A trap involving written runes (such as a Glyph of Warding or Symbol spell).
place: A library or another storehouse of written knowledge.
treasure: A valuable or magical pen, an ink vial, or a set of pigments (such as Nolzur's Marvelous Pigments).
A valuable or magical written work, such as a book or scroll.
situation: A situation that requires gleaning information from written clues.
Secrets that should never have been discovered but were written down.
